description.p: A man with his brain exposed begins glowing as the objects in the room around him float, suddenly, seemingly by a force of wind, each of the floating objects begin flying directly towards his assassins. A kobold cackles manically as her enemies begin psychically catching fire. The old gnomish man stands in his classroom, teaching a new generation of Telepaths solely through his mind.

Unlike wizards who spend their time studying the arcane arts to learn to cast spells, the Telepath studies the arts of the mind and uses it to develop psychic powers. As a Telepath, you will manipulate the powers of your mind to alter the world around you in many different ways such as creating fires, lifting heavy objects, or predicting the future.

Telepaths are concerned about improving their psychic abilities and learning how to use them to command the world around them, gaining control of themselves, or power over others. It is important to understand that while their abilities are learned just like magic, the Telepath does not cast spells using arcane study. They instead use their intellect to gain control over their innate powers and psychically channel them into a physical force.

Unlike Sorcerers, every technically intelligent creature has the ability to access psychic powers with hard dedication and study, however, some creatures are inherently better at it than others, such as a High Elf being able to perform telepathic abilities at a much earlier age due to their natural intellect.

While psychic powers are innate in every creature, they are accessed by gaining control over the mind. However, the mind is a fragile thing, and sometimes, you can discover early developments of psychic abilities from an outburst of some kind.

When creating your Telepath, think about what kind of Telepath you are and how you came to discover your innate psychic abilities. Perhaps the local fortune teller adopted you and taught you the ways of clairvoyance. Maybe in a fit of rage, your psychic powers lit your family home ablaze and you learned that you have the ability to become a Pyrokinetic.

After you understand how you came to become a Telepath, a good question to ask is how your character became an adventurer. Did you want to use your psychic powers to save people? Did you want to learn the secrets of the telepathic arts and become a master of the mind? Perhaps you seek revenge against a community that shunned you for a sudden psychic outburst you could not control.
You can make a 1st level Telepath quickly by following these suggestions. First, intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by constitution. Second, select the Acolyte background.
As an telepath, you gain the following class features.

ul.li: Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per telepath level after 1st
Tools: A gaming set of your choice
Skills: Choose two from Arcana, History, Investigation, Religion, Insight, Perception, Medicine

description.p: You start with the following equipment, in addition to the equipment granted by your background:

ul.li: (a) a light crossbow and 20 bolts or (b) any simple weapon
(a) A gaming set of your choice
(a) a priest’s pack, (b) a scholar’s pack or (c) an explorer’s pack

description.p: Alternatively, instead of choosing the telepath’s starting equipment, you may roll 3d4 x 10 and take the number rolled in gold.
To multiclass into the telepath class, you need an Intelligence Score of 13.

tr.td: Psychic Aura, Psychic Strike, Basic Telepathy
Spark of Power (1 Use), Aether Sight

description.p: Starting at 1st level, your psychic abilities manifest in the form of a sphere that is centered around you. The majority of the telepath’s abilities are focused around this aura. The aura can be activated or deactivated as a bonus action. The range of your psychic aura increases as you gain more telepath levels as displayed in the Aura Range column of the telepath class table. Additionally, starting at 1st level, you can perform two of the most basic telepath feats, a Psychic Strike and Basic Telepathy.

sheet.description: You can activate or deactivate your psychic aura, which has a {{psychic-aura:range}}-foot range.

description.p: As an action, you may target a creature within your psychic aura that you can see and make a ranged attack against them. This attack can be flavored to take any form such as a floating weapon or a ghost-like hand. The range of this attack is equal to your psychic aura’s range. On a hit, a target creature takes 1d10 force damage. You may add your Intelligence modifier to your psychic strike’s attack and damage rolls rather than your Strength modifier.
Psychic Strike uses somatic and verbal components just like a spell, therefore, if you cannot speak or move, you may not use your psychic strike.

sheet.description: You target a creature that you can see within {{psychic-aura:range}} feet and make a ranged attack against them, +{{intelligence:modifier}} to hit. On a hit, a target creature takes 1d10 + {{intelligence:modifier}} force damage.

description.p: You are able to use your psychic powers to communicate with other creatures. If a creature is in your psychic aura, you can communicate with it telepathically. You may only use this to communicate with one creature in your psychic aura at a time and only if that creature understands at least one language or can speak telepathically itself. A creature you are speaking to telepathically can respond so long as it is in your psychic aura.

When you are speaking to a creature that you do not share a language with, you may attempt an Intelligence (Arcana) check to communicate your intentions, ideas, and feelings with the creature as best you can and vice verca. The DC for this check is 22 - the creature’s Intelligence score. For example, if the target creature’s intelligence score is 8 and you do not share a language with it, the DC to communicate clearly with them is 14.

sheet.description: You can telepathically communicate with a single creature within {{psychic-aura:range}} feet of you.A creature you are speaking to telepathically can respond so long as it is in your psychic aura.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you begin to specialize in a form of psychic manipulation known as an esperism. Your esperism grants you features at 2nd level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th levels. The esperisms are detailed at the end of this class.

Starting at 3rd level, you may unleash a quick burst of psychic energy that allows you to perform a powerful supernatural feat. What feat you perform is determined by your esperism. Alternatively, you may use your spark of power to activate your Aether Sight.

You must finish a short or long rest before using this feature again. You may use your spark of power twice per short or long rest at 7th level, three times at 11th level, and four times at 15th level.

sheet.description: You can use your spark of power to activate Aether Sight or the feat granted by your esperism.

description.p: You’ve gained the ability to psychicly link your eyesight to the great beyond, allowing you to see things unseen by others such as the dead and the invisible.
As an action, you may use your spark of power to see into the ethereal plane a number of feet equal to double your psychic aura’s radius for 1 minute.

sheet.description: You can see {{aether-sight:range}} feet into the ethereal plane for 1 minute.

description.p: When you reach 4th Level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two Ability Scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can’t increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
Starting at 5th level, when you use your action to make an attack, you may perform two attacks instead of one. You may use this feature to make two psychic strike attacks as well.

sheet.description: When you use your action to make an attack, you may perform two attacks instead of one. You may use this feature to make two psychic strike attacks as well.

description.p: At 9th level, you can use your mind to heal the minds of others. During a short rest, up to five target creatures gain temporary hit points equal to your telepath level + your intelligence modifier. A creature cannot be affected by mindmend more than once per long rest, and these temporary hit points end after an hour.

sheet.description: During a short rest, you can grant up to five target creatures {{mindmend:temp-hp}} temporary hit points. A creature cannot be affected by mindmend more than once per long rest, and these temporary hit points end after an hour.

description.p: At 18th level, you’ve become adept enough at controlling your own mind that you can block commands of others attempting to control other creature’s minds. As an action, you can target a creature in your aura and end a condition affecting that creature’s mind such as the frightened or charmed condition. You can also use this to end diseases, curses, or features that affect a creature’s Intelligence score or gives the creature disadvantage on Intelligence checks specifically such as the Intellect Devourer’s Devour Intellect feature or the Mindfire disease.

sheet.description: You can target a creature in your aura and end a condition affecting that creature’s mind such as the frightened or charmed condition. You can also use this to end diseases, curses, or features that affect a creature’s Intelligence score or gives the creature disadvantage on Intelligence checks.

description.p: At 20th level, you gain mastery of your telepathic powers and become an Omnipath. You can now use your telepathy to communicate with any creature on any plane of existence for an indefinite distance and time, so long as you are aware of their existence. Additionally, no Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to communicate with creatures you do not share a language with.

sheet.description: You can now use your telepathy to communicate with any creature on any plane of existence for an indefinite distance and time, so long as you are aware of their existence. Additionally, no Intelligence (Arcana) check is required to communicate with creatures you do not share a language with.

description.p: Clairvoyants are known for practicing psychic abilities that can predict the future and gather information. They are the most common of Telepaths, often making livings for themselves by becoming fortune tellers.
Starting at 2nd level, your psychic aura detects the presence of magic. You become aware if something magical is in your psychic aura and it’s position.

sheet.description: You become aware if something magical is in your psychic aura and it’s position.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, as an action, you may target a creature within your psychic aura. If the creature is unwilling, roll an Intelligence (Arcana) check contested by the target creature’s Wisdom (Insight) check. If you succeed the contest or the creature is willing, you learn one detail about the creature that comes to your mind in the form of a vague omen, such as a dark shadow representing the creature’s evil alignment. The DM can choose to be directly vague about this detail, only having you interpret it through the symbolism of the omen.

div.p: To add flavor to the Omen feature, your DM may have a set of tarot cards on hand and have you interpret the omen through a quick tarot reading.

sheet.description: You may target a creature within your psychic aura. If the creature is unwilling, roll an Arcana check contested by the target creature’s Insight check. If you succeed the contest or the creature is willing, you learn one detail about the creature that comes to your mind in the form of a vague omen

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, when you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you may expend a use of your Spark of Power to use your Intelligence modifier for the roll if it did not use it already. Additionally, you may add your proficiency bonus to the roll or double your proficiency bonus if you are already proficient.

sheet.description: When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you may expend a use of your Spark of Power to use your Intelligence modifier for the roll if it did not use it already. Additionally, you may add +{{proficiency}} to the roll or +{{proficiency:double}} if you are already proficient.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, you can grant creature’s in your aura with clairvoyant powers. While a creature is in your aura, when it makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can use your reaction to allow that creature to re-roll, the creature must take the new roll. You can only use this feature twice per long rest.

sheet.description: While a creature is in your aura, when it makes an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can allow that creature to re-roll, the creature must take the new roll.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, you can use the scrying, divination, or clairvoyance spells without consuming material components. You may only cast each spell once per long rest. Intelligence is your spellcasting modifier for these spells.

sheet.description: You can use the scrying, divination, or clairvoyance spells without consuming material components. You may only cast each spell once per long rest.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, your clairvoyant powers allow you to see through all. You are constantly under the effects of the Aether Sight feature. The range of the aether sight granted through this feature is equal to your psychic aura rather than double it’s range.
You may expend a use of your spark of power feature to double the aether sight like normal.

sheet.description: You are constantly under the effects of the Aether Sight feature to a range of {{psychic-aura:range}} feet. You may expend a use of your spark of power feature to double the aether sight like normal.

description.p: Pyrokinetics are telepaths that use their psychic abilities to conjure and control fire, making them adept fighters. Most pyrokinetics are prone to fits of rage that can cause fire related accidents, as such, most telepath’s shun the practice as it is the most volitile and dangerous.

center.p: Pyrokinetic Feature DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you learn to use your psychic powers to emit fire and heat. As a bonus action, you may cause a wave of heat to emit from your psychic aura. At the end of each of your turns, hostile creatures in your psychic aura take 2 fire damage. This damage increases by 1 at 5th level, and again at 11th level and 17th level.
You may deactivate this feature as a bonus action.

sheet.description: You may cause a wave of heat to emit from your psychic aura. At the end of each of your turns, hostile creatures in your psychic aura take {{aura-of-ignis:damage}} fire damage. You may deactivate this feature as a bonus action. Your pyrokinetic save DC is {{pyrokinetic:save-dc}}.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, when you make an attack against a creature using your Psychic Strike feature, you may cause your psychic strike to deal fire damage instead of force damage. When you use this feature, each creature within 5 feet of your target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to half of the damage dealt to the target creature.

sheet.description: When you make an attack against a creature using your Psychic Strike feature, you may cause your psychic strike to deal fire damage instead of force damage. When you use this feature, each creature within 5 feet of your target must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take fire damage equal to half of the damage dealt to the target creature.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you may expend a use of your spark of power to cause your psychic aura to emit a wall of flame until the start of your next turn. Whenever a creature enters or exits your psychic aura, that creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature can only be affected by this feature once per turn.

sheet.description: You cause your psychic aura to emit a wall of flame until the start of your next turn. Whenever a creature enters or exits your psychic aura, that creature must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 fire damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature can only be affected by this feature once per turn.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, as an action, you may cause your psychic aura to send out a burst of flame. Each creature other than you in your psychic aura must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 fire damage or half as much on a successful save.
You must finish a long rest before using this feature again.

sheet.description: You cause your psychic aura to send out a burst of flame. Each creature other than you in your psychic aura must succeed a Dexterity saving throw or take 6d6 fire damage or half as much on a successful save.

description.p: You’ve become adept enough at commanding fire that you now know how to fight against it. Starting at 10th level, you are resistant to fire damage. Additionally, as a reaction, when an allied creature in your aura would be affected by fire damage originating from you, you may cause that creature to take no damage from it.
You may only use this feature on two creatures at a time.

sheet.description: When up to 2 allied creatures in your aura would be affected by fire damage originating from you, you may cause those creatures to take no damage from it.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, as a bonus action, you may envelop yourself in fire for 1 minute. While you are in this state, you may use your reaction when a creature hits you with a melee attack to deal 1d12 fire damage to that creature. Additionally, while in this state, your psychic strikes deal the maximum amount of damage they can on a hit.
You must finish a long rest before using this feature again.

sheet.description: You may envelop yourself in fire for 1 minute. While you are in this state, you may use your reaction when a creature hits you with a melee attack to deal 1d12 fire damage to that creature. Additionally, while in this state, your psychic strikes deal the maximum amount of damage they can on a hit.

description.p: Sonokinetics are telepaths that have learned to command and control all manners of sound. From emulating sounds, to creating loud, deafening noises, sonokinetics can control sound to it’s core.

center.p: Sonokinetic Feature DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you learn to use your aura to make yourselves and others quieter. When you or a creature makes a Dexterity (Stealth) check while in your aura, they may add half their proficiency bonus (rounded up) to the roll.

sheet.description: When you or a creature makes a Stealth check while in your aura, they may add half their proficiency bonus (rounded up) to the roll.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, you can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check opposed by your Charisma (Deception) check. When making a Charisma (Deception) check using this feature, you may use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Charisma modifier.
You may also use this feature while speaking telepathically to a creature.

sheet.description: You can mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations with a successful Insight check opposed by your Deception check. When making a Charisma (Deception) check using this feature, you may use your Intelligence modifier. You may also use this feature while speaking telepathically to a creature.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, you may expend a use of your spark of power to cause an ear piercing sound to occur from your psychic aura. Each creature other than you in your psychic aura that can hear you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 psychic damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature that fails this save becomes deafened.

sheet.description: You cause an ear piercing sound to occur from your psychic aura. Each creature other than you in your psychic aura that can hear you must succeed a Constitution saving throw or take 4d6 psychic damage or half as much on a successful save. A creature that fails this save becomes deafened. Your sonokinetic save DC is {{sonokinetic:save-dc}}.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, as a bonus action, you may target a creature you can see within your psychic aura and plug their ear drums. That creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become deafened until the end of your next turn. A creature that is not aware of your presence does not know that you did this and simply feels as though they had something stuck in their ear.

sheet.description: You may target a creature you can see within your psychic aura and plug their ear drums. That creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or become deafened until the end of your next turn. A creature that is not aware of your presence does not know that you did this and simply feels as though they had something stuck in their ear.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, as an action. you may cause yourself, an object, or another creature in your psychic aura to sound differently. This sound can be as loud as six times their normal voice’s volume or completely silent. You may also change the sounds a creature themselves creates such as causing them to sound as if they speak a different language, changing the tone of their words to make them sound rude or aggressive, making a creature speak new words they did not mean to speak, making mundane sounds such as footsteps sound differently, or changing their pitch. You may use any combination of these effects on a creatures voice and may change the effects at will. If a creature is unwilling to have their voice changed, they must succeed a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you will be able to affect a creature with this feature for 1 minute. After the duration has past, a creature may re-attempt the saving throw.

A creature is aware their voice has been tampered with after hearing it. Another creature must succeed an Wisdom (Insight) check opposed by your Charisma (Deception) check in order to understand if the sounds coming from the creature are normal for that creature. When making a Charisma (Deception) check using this feature, you may use your Intellegence modifier instead of your Charisma modifier.

sheet.description: You may cause yourself, an object, or another creature in your psychic aura to sound differently. A creature is aware their voice has been tampered with after hearing it. Another creature must succeed an Insight check opposed by your Deception check in order to understand if the sounds coming from the creature are normal for that creature. When making a Deception check using this feature, you may use your Intellegence modifier instead of your Charisma modifier.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, you may target a creature within your psychic aura and attempt to damage the cerebrum in such a way that it causes that creature to be deaf for a long time. As an action, target a creature within your aura’s radius, that creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take 6d10 psychic damage and become deafened for 1 year. This deafness cannot be cured by anything short of a wish spell. However, you may choose to end the deafness early as an action so long as the creature is within range of your aura. You may also choose for this psychic damage to be non-lethal.
You must finish a long rest before using this feature again.

sheet.description: You target a creature within your aura’s radius, that creature must succeed a Wisdom saving throw or take 6d10 psychic damage and become deafened for 1 year. You may choose to end the deafness early as an action so long as the creature is within range of your aura. You may also choose for this psychic damage to be non-lethal.

description.p: Telekinetics are telepaths that command the laws of motion to allow themselves to lift and control objects.
Starting at 2nd level, when you or an allied creature starts it’s turn in your psychic aura, that creature gains an additional 5ft of movement speed this turn.

sheet.description: When you or an allied creature starts it’s turn in your psychic aura, that creature gains an additional 5ft of movement speed this turn.

description.p: Starting at 2nd level, when determining your carrying capacity, you may instead use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier and can choose to telekinetically lift objects in your aura. Additionally, you can use your action to use the Grapple, Shove, or the Use an Item actions against any creature or item in your Psychic Aura. Any Strength checks made with these actions can be made with an Intelligence check instead. A creature or object grappled or lifted this way can be freely moved by you as a bonus action, however, moving a creature this way does not provoke attack of opportunities and the creature or object cannot leave your Psychic Aura range this way. While you have a creature or object lifted this way, you can throw them a distance of up to 10ft out of the aura as a bonus action. If the creature hits a surface or an object hits a creature roll the damage for your psychic strike feature. A creature thrown this way does not take additional damage from falling.
The type of damage taken will be appropriate for the surface hit or the object thrown such as bludgeoning if the creature hits a wall.

sheet.description: When determining your carrying capacity, you may instead use your Intelligence modifier instead of your Strength modifier and can choose to telekinetically lift objects in your aura. Additionally, you can use your action to use the Grapple, Shove, or the Use an Item actions against any creature or item in your Psychic Aura. Any Strength checks made with these actions can be made with an Intelligence check instead.

description.p: Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you may expend a use of your spark of power to create a barrier of telekinetic energy surrounding your psychic aura. This barrier has an AC of 18 and 20 hit points. Once this feature is activated, your psychic aura is centered around the barrier rather than you until the barrier vanishes. The barrier blocks all creatures from entering or exiting and stops all projectiles. Creatures can see through the barrier however.
The barrier vanishes at the end of your next turn, when you disable it as a bonus action, or when it drops to 0 hit points.

sheet.description: You create a barrier of telekinetic energy surrounding your psychic aura. This barrier has an AC of 18 and 20 hit points. Once this feature is activated, your psychic aura is centered around the barrier rather than you until the barrier vanishes. The barrier blocks all creatures from entering or exiting and stops all projectiles. Creatures can see through the barrier however. The barrier vanishes at the end of your next turn, when you disable it as a bonus action, or when it drops to 0 hit points.

description.p: Starting at 6th level, as an action, you may attempt a grapple check against a creature you can see within a range equal to double your psychic aura’s range. If you succeed the grapple, the creature grappled by you and is pulled into range of your psychic aura.

sheet.description: You may attempt a grapple check against a creature you can see within a range equal to double your psychic aura’s range. If you succeed the grapple, the creature grappled by you and is pulled into range of your psychic aura.

description.p: Starting at 10th level, as an action, you may expend a use of your spark of power to force a hostile creature in your aura to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 force damage and is knocked back 10ft, taking half damage and not getting not knocked back on a successful save.

center.p: DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier

sheet.description: You force a hostile creature in your aura to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 5d8 force damage and is knocked back 10ft, taking half damage and not getting not knocked back on a successful save.

description.p: Starting at 14th level, as a bonus action, when you hit a creature with a psychic strike, you may attempt to grapple that creature.

sheet.description: When you hit a creature with a psychic strike, you may attempt to grapple that creature.
